<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Magic Armor](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2804)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=637" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 229 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn armor

**Bulk**  varies by armor
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A suit of magic armor is simply a suit of armor or explorer’s clothing etched with fundamental runes. An [armor potency](/Equipment.aspx?ID=278) rune increases the armor’s item bonus to AC, and a [resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=279) rune adds an item bonus to saving throws.

 The Prices here are for all types of armor. You don’t need to adjust the Price from [leather armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4) to [full plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=13) or the like. These armors are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as dawnsilver.
